289DA61EF4814DD1BCBA711963441973.description: Develop messages that use logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

2A7EF40A8F744808B3666D9B2FDBB4C2.description:
Employ effective repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery style to
convey message to impact the audience.

5D89B62B5BFA4E43B521E6324C0C2677.description:
Remain conscious of the audience and anticipate possible misconceptions
or objections.

84745ED2E25B464493A6C65324548192.description: Incorporate craft techniques to engage and impact audience and convey messages

3DFEEF179EB04C9F9E210939F7AD7A09.description:
Analyze the speaker’s use of repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery
style to convey the message and impact the audience.

5AF9F0F3E8D24B1DB256371E26F31EC6.description:
Determine if the speaker develops well-organized messages that use
logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

4AA75C4F42AA4B14A6DE02F2297C69CA.description:
Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and
rhetoric, identifying any fallacies in reasoning or exaggerated or distorted
evidence.

2F651313BD0E44EC9F38D0810B67CAD8.description: Critique how a speaker addresses content and uses craft techniques that stylistically and structurally inform, engage, and impact audience and convey messages.

5CEFC8ACAC9D4DF9874C973FB5D73656.description:
Create visual and/or multimedia presentations, using a variety of media
forms to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence for
diverse audiences.

17B3C1270523432EB7BE42F3EFE3ADF1.description:
Analyze how context influences the mode of communication used by the
presenter in a given situation.

917B59B861CA41238149DB2945A1EE0D.description: Communicate information through strategic use of multiple modalities and multimedia to enrich understanding when presenting ideas and information.

3805E148A6F847E18BF4714C8855F491.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using standard English
when indicated or appropriate.

BD48A1662661467AA8E7E491AEDD4B30.description:
Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding
plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

F583F6032BCF4E9B98CA4A65805AF32E.description: Distinguish between credible and non-credible sources of information.

AD338567D79B447397EDA1B8373C374F.description:
Present information and findings from multiple authoritative sources;
assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question,
citing supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that
listeners can follow the line of reasoning, and the organization,
development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience,
and task.

EA1E230F3271414EAFE4BA369CAC293E.description: Articulate ideas, claims, and perspectives in a logical sequence using information, findings, and credible evidence from sources.

F9A649546B5343D49387F772F9884606.description:
Utilize various modes of communication to present a clear, unique
interpretation of diverse perspectives.

F81E3D0789934AF8B843EFBB735C0E66.description:
Synthesize areas of agreement and disagreement including justification
for personal perspective; revise conclusions based on new evidence.

A833D56AD95340359CA1128660B6F79D.description:
Engage in dialogue with peers and adults to explore meaning and
interaction of ideas, concepts, and elements of text, reflecting,
constructing, and articulating new understandings.

46D2A9E9B4B54AFB8931F44EB6377134.description:
Develop, apply, and adjust reciprocal communication skills and
techniques with other students and adults.

AECCAB5A5759494E8E6D3ED50D099AF5.description:
Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions
with diverse partners; build on the ideas of others and express own ideas
clearly and persuasively

57712D2CA9A64E5597B5E496C27B551F.description:
Gather information from print and multimedia sources to prepare for
discussions; draw on evidence that supports the topic, text, or issue being
discussed; and develop logical interpretations of new findings.

9366419CF5C644F2A847BEEDBF5F0B1C.description: Interact with others to explore ideas and concepts, communicate meaning, and develop logical interpretations through collaborative conversations; build upon the ideas of others to clearly express one’s own views while respecting diverse perspectives.

2CCACC903D084A0DA525CD01131BED63.description:
Write routinely and persevere in writing tasks over short and extended
time frames, for a range of domain-specific tasks, and for a variety of
purposes and audiences.

C3C801AB7CEA4A1186B830A67F6C595F.description: Write independently, legibly, and routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences over short and extended time frames.

FE805CC39A5C4261966D16F4F0794CCB.description: Commas to separate adjacent, parallel structures

F0EA64E6CC464AD08CC42C579792F82E.description: A colon to introduce a list or quotation

51B7BC9A74224E29ABADF7D22249DC45.description:
A semicolon or a conjunctive adverb to link two or more closely
related independent clauses

B88FC54F4DDD4507A8519A7040FE1D39.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6300814E6A1441CB8C0F5506EA8F7931.description:
Use noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, and
absolute phrases and independent, dependent, noun, relative, and
adverbial clauses to convey specific meanings and add variety and
interest to writing

C3D84A02439646FB990E0506B7889178.description: Use parallel structures to communicate similar ideas

03F34D228841488B8B35D70B6EEC6A2D.description:
Use independent, dependent, noun, relative, and adverbial phrases
and clauses to convey shades of meaning and variety

4D98B6C50E2043C8AEA273F1CAF67E23.description:
Use verb, noun, prepositional, and verbal phrases to communicate
different meanings

986F858EC7A1419EB42EA3C3BB75E56A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

764169D246774A3F8EA8BBE7625AA6C3.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is
experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative

3CFA39F6E6AF4F97A0E38E2D926FF2BE.description:
Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language
to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or
characters

0AAE43136D2A4C368756B8572CC68D8C.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, rewriting

739A47BE66BD457E80ED9FD87CD80AA8.description:
Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on
one another to create a coherent whole

C28E7B6E870D49079C34B811A1AAF012.description:
Use narrative techniques of dialogue, pacing, description, reflection,
and multiple plot lines to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters

213ED7881BB9412093F0F98E7D8D0E4A.description:
Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or
observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression
of experiences or events

753B5A2897B44256AFC8D168E9633F00.description:
Develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences

350A1DD69AC4419F9F4CC8E0E48C1150.description:
Gather ideas from texts, multimedia, and personal experience to write
narratives that:

5FDF754EAE7B4E1096306F3B73F68F83.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, well-chosen details, and well structured event sequences.

2D8BD5AF05304DE19BA514FB9F500715.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and
supports the information or explanation presented

BC85F66CEF4A4281A35CE75B25824C12.description:
Establish and maintain a consistent style and objective tone while
attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline

FA738C17B5B243D09423335DD320E554.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the
complexity of the topic

FDC301BAFC5D42F6B3AEFC7EAC73BA9D.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of
the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among
complex ideas and concepts

A38EC38049AA47009B5C1B1A06B71A28.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, rewriting

D079CCAFC26F48EEBE4B8B86706FDF4F.description:
Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while
avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

2E44584974264029A7ADBFBA9D872F53.description:
Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts,
extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge
of the topic

081C91D11122496EBCE7788C8F1D9671.description:
Include formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension
as needed

B64A99E7CFD64043967FE0ADFDA61256.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

10AE0EE3C245434CA05973F617790136.description:
Organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make
connections and distinctions

F2814E929E684A029C132F34713BB2A2.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

FE3245FB20CF488BBE5176245A5036AF.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

FDD52D6B35ED4E8EBAB0FEE53178BA11.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and
supports the argument presented

6E6779EF0EA1484994BB0ECB43ECEDC8.description:
Avoid logical fallacies and demonstrate an understanding of
objectivity and subjectivity

BEDB9FAC871047D4854365E8F18717E9.description:
Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while
avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

C69B938147E24DF3928ED1DBBD7ABB28.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, rewriting

961C8A5B3EAF413BBC8AF070C041398B.description:
Develop the claim and counterclaims ethically without bias,
providing credible evidence and accurate interpretation of data for
each while delineating the strengths and limitations of the claim and
counterclaims

C5F4764517274A92815A22D87BB0269C.description:
Use an organizational structure that logically sequences and
establishes clear relationships among claims, counterclaims, reasons,
warrants, and evidence

8DEC8D79D2C3482C9EAC3FF2D6FC76A3.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

841F994E80D14EA7ADEA279167F8B422.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

DA3A9E5E59CA40CDB972B28B3E9FB804.description:
Introduce a precise claim and differentiate between the claim and
counterclaims

49221C68C1BA48BE883F357E3640B2A1.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

975B894840D74E6097392EE1C186BDC0.description:
Read and respond to grade-level text to become self-directed, critical
readers and thinkers.

B147233B39114D71BA36C07C85BDF53F.description: Read independently for a sustained period of time.

4BD776E849C641BE95D2B5B4AFAA3AD6.description:
Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and
understanding.

353D5FB3DA974FC2B74E65749A22A3A6.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text over time.

944FCDB4F80D4DF988A41F34C0D19EDD.description:
Analyze and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text,
assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and
sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

CCB963BEE82E42E7B6F134A95B646DFF.description:
Analyze in detail how the author’s ideas or claims are supported through
the use of text features and structures.

A51DFABA29A647B688A4449ADA9ABDA3.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in print and multimedia texts to craft informational and argument writing.

93C34F84653B49539CBD9D6DF57CDF9D.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze
how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

35D87E7AB45345D6A3DA040D9FE5B369.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice of purpose and perspective shapes content, meaning, and style.

6590EBD0E628402B8F44FF52DBC00FC1.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

B313A37586224A1D8D36ECD12A476274.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine the meaning of known, unknown, and multiple meaning words, phrases, and jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

7BF4E555FD2849F5B5F49F9E9F9278F7.description:
Explain how the author’s meaning and tone are developed and refined by
text features and structures.

A6AEB3CDF88244F79C6B4D3BA73BBFA9.description:
Determine figurative, connotative, or technical meanings of words and
phrases; analyze the cumulative impact of specific words, phrases on
meaning and tone.

38A5A4E76C2041FF852E75B16CF98DD8.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases, text features, conventions, and structures, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

8AC09ABAB1FC42608A18703637FD540C.description:
Explain how the use of different mediums, modalities, or formats impacts
the reader’s understanding of events, topics, concepts, and ideas in
argument or informative texts.

BC451181C0AB47FF9D04A0D9B1881C9D.description: Research events, topics, ideas, or concepts through multiple media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities.

8D09007644304C8FB65E2F7DE73B6E82.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the
course of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by
specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

EEBF033D47CE4ABDA7850BE92F4B7C4F.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of central ideas.

E0096ED9232A4C37AD6A35F4A422A601.description:
Cite significant textual evidence in order to articulate explicit meanings
and meanings that can be inferred from the text; identify multiple
supported interpretations.

7D46665CD0534D91B9546471D94E6153.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing, synthesizing, providing evidence and investigating multiple interpretations.

6B5C1D5741A94C5987D6DD61C9A81947.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

9394746992BF4BA38B19AE4C6D282785.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

60D64C727FD248109B5FFBE930F4A5A5.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds.

8EE512E8611C477395B5A81F681A7EC7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

697E7CC2B5BF43C896F80A9AAC524CA0.description:
Read and respond to grade level text to become self-directed, critical
readers and thinkers.

995CEFDEC56E4ED9BF573F011EB397D1.description: Read independently for sustained periods of time to build stamina.

4BD591BE5F2C4D05BA1641BC100F4D25.description:
Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and
understanding.

4750A10F15674A1181EC15205FC3E762.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text over time.

EC26FC3DFFD44148A4D59793DEECDB91.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text,
order events within the text, and manipulate time create different
effects.

82911D969B294E7B9AC09E5FCE3D43AF.description:
Analyze how the relationships among structure, plot, and manipulation
of time create the effects of mystery, tension, or surprise citing support
from the text.

7D3F24A923A349C2A982C245FAE7B19A.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in print and multimedia texts to shape meaning and impact the reader.

31F451458EEC4D7BB01715685003FF2A.description:
Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice of point of
view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and style.

A61DBC509D884FC8A8F9A1F510748C58.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice of point of view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and style.

1C0BCCA0F7C1402BAC0EE6D7C14ACDE0.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

A433D8F8815F4103AA3E4DDADC1F06CF.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine and deepen the meaning of known, unknown, and multiple-meaning words, phrases, and jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

D74B21C712BF4D3EBA4A032DD8046CE2.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases, and conventions, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

780ED4E90E49440C861ABFA371A19B57.description:
Analyze how characters or a series of ideas or events is introduced,
connected, and developed within a particular context.

E9A30F3BBA5646FF898F98DCBF953336.description: Analyze characters, settings, events, and ideas as they develop and interact within a particular context.

9EBE28F2B7844D64919A0BA1216FFFF4.description:
Explain how literary texts and related media allude to themes and
archetypes from historical and cultural traditions.

5D7BB7F52665458592DC6D13EB2CB60F.description:
Trace the development of a common theme across media, modality, and
format.

030BE4BE7A9245E5AD231AF48A8CA0B8.description: Analyze the relationship among ideas, themes, or topics in multiple media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities.

0B7EB438E3E04E86ADBDA971A2C8931D.description:
Determine a theme of a text and analyze its development over the course
of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by
specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

EF57A99D6D4645CDAC9BCFF428C1C1BA.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of thematic development.

8E2895CF0D1E405D99CB0377F4218EC0.description:
Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the
text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text; identify
multiple supported interpretations.

331D8124669A463E808B8E37AA98117F.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing, synthesizing, providing evidence, and investigating multiple interpretations.

D2C81358FC5F451BA4EFE5E2D31EDDC1.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

C48EBF82EEA14FE0938F467655A235AB.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

0E09FC4E23394582851075EF7A27617A.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds.

6E1EC0DD35C64893BB3B76A4A77ADFA2.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

C6C694F35B64482F80697FCB005AB62B.description:
Analyze the process to evaluate and revise plan and strategies; address
successes and misconceptions; and apply learning to future inquiry.

DC67409BC5A04A448C6674813B01F9E6.description:
Analyze and evaluate previous assumptions; test claims; predict
outcomes; and justify results to guide future action.

5E74444586624861A48CC459FAC4BB5C.description:
Acknowledge and consider individual and collective thinking; use
feedback to guide the inquiry process.

731E41D347B148B7874FDECDBEAE0547.description: Reflect throughout the inquiry process to assess metacognition, broaden understanding, and guide actions, both individually and collaboratively.

C0B743DD3FC647E9BFA9EFFA98F2B80E.description:
Determine appropriate disciplinary tools to communicate findings and/or
take informed action.

7BD8CE06027D455BA793CAFE688086F7.description:
Evaluate findings; address conflicting information; identify
misconceptions; and revise.

8011D2F03B6D42BAB14F5CF2A7FA71DB.description:
Employ a critical stance to analyze relationships and patterns of evidence
to confirm conclusions.

B9155CF043D54996A3F43E009D70C98B.description: Synthesize information to share learning and/or take action.

911A3FFA523440329CE8DCF27200A57D.description:
Organize and categorize important information; synthesize relevant ideas
to build a deeper understanding; communicate new learning; identify
implications for future inquiry.

6ABA69A0B5D14AA9B2BC29B90B5FE64D.description:
Gather information from a variety of primary and secondary sources and
evaluate for perspective, validity, and bias.

A1A94CE4D05941838E65C37A95878F1A.description:
Examine historical, social, cultural, or political context to broaden
inquiry and create questions.

6A2813474A7443C1BFE7AF2D8D68AE40.description:
Develop a plan of action by using appropriate discipline specific
strategies.

5231959BD31F4523A9599730947AA106.description: Construct knowledge, applying disciplinary concepts and tools, to build deeper understanding of the world through exploration, collaboration, and analysis.

747297F8336444D78C9910CBB03A75F7.description:
Analyze ideas and information from text and multimedia by formulating
questions, proposing interpretations and explanations, and considering
alternative views and multiple perspectives.

B778A39977BA448CA5E4A6A2924729D0.description: Transact with texts to formulate questions, propose explanations, and consider alternative views and multiple perspectives.

508F3A1A08374768940DF32C3379BDCA.description:
Use a recursive process to develop, refine, and evaluate questions to
broaden thinking on a specific idea that directs inquiry for new learning
and deeper understanding.

B2CB9BA71D5C4FD68C932FDD62442A2F.description: Formulate relevant, self-generated questions based on interests and/or needs that can be investigated.
